name: Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I recently spent a week at the San Diego Resort on MIssion Bay. I was actually running a conference there, which I feel brings a more critical eye to a review, as I had 200 people letting me know what they thought.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: In one word: amazing. I had been here pre-renovation, and almost didn't recognize this property. The location sure doesn't hurt, but the atmosphere is created by the hotel. Everywhere I went the grounds were well kept, the pool area was gorgeous and relaxing, the fireplaces throughout the public areas were so inviting...I loved the feeling throughout the resort.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for us

reviews.text: The food was always wonderful, especially when served in the new restaurant that overlooks the bay, next to yet another fireplace.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The final ribbon on this prize is was the staff. They were completely dedicated to making this stay amazing. Thank you!
reviews.title: Noise

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Villas area with connected rooms. The Villas are one and two story. The rooms have a modern decor that has recently been updated. The pool area was very nice.
reviews.title: San Diego Hilton - Above Average

likes.disliked: — sparse set up of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, well-decorated rooms. Good pool area. Lots of on site activity options. If you don't know San Diego and will be at the hotel a lot this is an excellent spot. It is close to Sea World. It is not on the ocean but rather Mission Bay which has no surf. The sailing and jet skiing are great here. One down side is there aren't close restaurants within walking distance. You'll have to drive to eat or stay in the resort which charges a bundle for breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: Great for families!

reviews.text: We spent 3 straight years here in the 1990s and loved it. They have done a recent remodel and the rooms have been updated nicely.
reviews.title: A nice stay at the San Diego Hilton Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a larger "lanai" room which gave a little more room for our two teenagers. I think the best rooms for families open up to the garden and allow young kids to walk around outside the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere at Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa

likes.liked: — Clean, Nice Resort Feel and Good on site dining/service

reviews.title: Not bad, wannabe "resort"
reviews.text: The beauty of this resort is the setting. You are right on Mission Bay and there are so many activities available on the bay itself from sailing to biking to just walking along the bayfront path. We lucked out with beautiful weather but there is a lot to in town even if the weather is not good.
A few glitches that i would be aware of:
reviews.title: Convenient one-night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel offers no shuttle service. That means no shuttle service to Seaworld and no shuttle service to the airport.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs

likes.disliked: — The hotel union worker protests that went on all day, plus no laundry facilities

reviews.text: Hotel offers no laundry facilities. That means if you want a t-shirt washed, it will cost you $6.95, ouch!
reviews.title: Terrible Terrible Terrible!! Left After One Day!!

reviews.text: Hotel offers major hotel worker protests. All day on 8/16/08 the hotel union workers had protests. They beat the drums, had loudspeakers and were really obnoxious. I felt sorry for all the vacationers including myself that had to listen to them protest all day long.
reviews.title: Not good.

likes.disliked: — Price, lack of service, lines at front desk, only restaurant too busy, pool too small, etc.

reviews.text: Hotel offers unattentive staff. Was at the pool for 2 hours and no waitstaff. Finally had to go to the bar to get a beer. Additionally, called the concierge (which was not available) left a message and it was 4 hours before I received a returned call.
reviews.title: Good standard but what the chargeable extras

reviews.text: I could go on and on (and am even still at the hotel), but will get right down to the point, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone and will NEVER return....
reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Way overpriced!!

likes.liked: — Close to alot of San Diego sites

reviews.text: Contacted hotel directly and then hotel toll free no. to make reservations for a family get together. This was our 3rd visit there and 2nd family get together. Agents and front desk do no know the deals offered by the hotel - you have to tell them and still speak up when checking in. I called directly to try to get 3 rooms close by with extended patio that the cousins might be able to play on and visit other rooms/hang out easily. Told agent that it was important to me and was willing to pay more for a room for my request. With taxes, the rooms were about $400 a night each. Upon arriving to our rooms, which were nicely situated all next to one another we found out that the extended patios were walled in in the back so not easy access among the
reviews.title: Over priced - maintenance issues

reviews.text: rooms and also were dusty with pine needles all over and their once nice outdoor furniture grimy. Not inviting at all. Had to call to get it cleaned. Also front desk never told us us that one room only had 1 king bed instead of the 2 queens we requested and needed ( 4 in our family). Strange, since we even requested an extra room key card so our 2 kids could share it.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

likes.liked: — jet ski rental and bike rental on property
likes.disliked: — no other restaurants, shops, etc walking distance

reviews.text: Rooms were fine with the extended section with an small counter top area with frig but a very uncomfortable sofa/chair ? No ventilation in any of the bathrooms so can't see the mirror after showers, lacks storage in the bathroom as well as the room if you are staying there with more than 2 people to a room.
reviews.title: Charming Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the 2nd to our last night, my husband found a mouse in our bathtub. Also found (perhaps same mice - he threw it out the back patio somehow) mouse in room next door right outside the sliding glass door. We never opened the slider door to patio after that. Called (before 10 AM ) to ask to have the bathroom cleaned really well - never came until mid afternoon (4 pm ?) even after going to the front desk in person at 2 pm to ask why no one had come to clean the tub and bathroom. and I think they only did the standard cleaning job. Can't say I want to ever go back there anymore.
reviews.title: this was absolutely rdiculous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that...the hotel is nice with it's own dock for water sport rentals, Mission bay view, and close location to Sea World. If you go there don't pay for an extended patio room unless you make sure you are getting the flat extended patio looking out at the bay and also avoid the height of summer. The hotel becomes too crazy crowded. Nice fitness facility and tennis courts. Spa was average but adding an automatic 20 % tip for the customer's convenience is a questionable practice to me.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!!

likes.liked: — Close to seaworld and other parks
likes.disliked: — The front desk and hotel service

aka: Hilton San Diego Hotel San Diego
